hero.title: Time's Up! Bike Co-op
hero.tagline: Learn to fix your bike at a volunteer-run repair workshop in the East Village.  Beginner friendly, no experience needed.

howItWorks.heading: How It Works
howItWorks.text: Bring your bike and describe the issue to a volunteer mechanic. We provide the tools and guidance but you will be hands on for the repair. Suggested $2 donation covers tool use and supplies.[](mailto:contact@timesup.bike)

helpfulTips.heading: Helpful Tips
helpfulTips.tips:
- Come early. Fixing one problem may reveal another
- No e-bikes, no new projects 30 minutes before closing
- We sell used parts onsite ([parts pricing](https://www.canva.com/design/DAGpoE5WunE/sd7Tocqw9nuRl_IhE9WkWA/view?utm_content=DAGpoE5WunE&utm_campaign=designshare&utm_medium=link2&utm_source=uniquelinks&utlId=hacf7432243))
- Check our [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/times_up_nyc/) for special hours and events
- For questions, contact us at [contact@timesup.bike](mailto:contact@timesup.bike)

hours.text:
Sunday & Wednesday, 5pm - 8pm.

images.alt: Volunteers welcome regardless of mechanical skill. We have plenty to do that don't require any wrenching.
Donations and fundraisers allow us to offer some of the lowest prices in the city
Saturday class at La Plaza Community Garden in the summer and early fall
Saturday class at La Plaza Community Garden in the summer and early fall
Flat fix class at La Plaza Community Garden
Late night at the coop
Spring workshop for repair, tuneup, parts installation, volunteering and general chit chat
We do not store personal bikes overnight, repairs occasionally last late into the evening so you can ride home
Repairs overflow onto the sidewalk when it is too crowded inside
Wheel building workshop
Repair workshops held on Sunday and Wednesday evenings
Get your hands dirty.  No need to wear your Sunday best.
It is a hands-on tutorial rather than the fastest service so give yourself a bit more time.  Some repairs may be split over multiple visits.
Flat fix class at La Plaza Community Garden
Sometimes you fix one problem and it reveals another so come early
Gloves provided.  We might even have that one-off tool you need
Sign in when you arrive.  No appointment needed.
We can handle most repairs except for cutting carbon fiber and diagnosing electronic shifting
Learn to fix your bike surrounded by artwork

We fix up and sell used commuter bikes for ~$160
Come browse our used parts bins, most secondhand parts are $5-$10.  We carry a limited stock of new parts.
Learn to fix your bike.  No experience needed
